data: When John Ryder put his foot upon the plank of the Minnequago on his return journey from Europe he was a bachelor of thirty-five summers—and had never counted his winters at all.
When John Ryder put his foot upon the plank of the _Minnequago_ on his return journey from Europe he was a bachelor of thirty-five summers--and had never counted his winters at all.

Hall, Charles Everett; Herbert, Robert Gaston, 1873-1954 [Illustrator]
